original: 1.2. Territory. The Territory is defined as that geographical area in which said Agent is represented by a full time field sales representative, and of which assigned Distributor agrees to be responsible for mutually agreed upon quarterly and annual sales objectives as described in the "Business Plan".
ollama_generated: 1.2. Territory Responsibility Shift. The Territory encompasses the geographical region where the Agent operates, specifically where a full-time field sales representative is present. However, it is important to note that the assigned Distributor is now only responsible for achieving mutual quarterly and annual sales objectives as outlined in the "Business Plan", subject to the approval of the Agent. The Distributor's responsibilities do not extend beyond this point.

original: (j) maintain sales and promotion of the Company's Products so as to meet or exceed the previous years annual sales within the same competitive environment.
ollama_generated: (j) strive to increase the sales volume of the Company's Products relative to the prior year, aiming for growth within the comparable competitive landscape; however, the Company acknowledges that fluctuations in market conditions may impact these efforts.

original: All payments will be made in United States Dollars without set-off or counterclaim, free and clear of (and without deduction for) any taxes, duties, charges, withholdings, restrictions or conditions of any nature imposed or levied by any political, taxing or other authority.
ollama_generated: All payments shall be remitted in U.S. Dollars, absolving either party from the exercise of any set-off or counterclaim, unencumbered by any tax liabilities, duties, charges, withholdings, encumbrances, or restrictions of any kind, now or hereafter imposed or levied by any political, fiscal, or other administrative body.

original: 2.4. Taxes. The Customer will bear all taxes and duties which may be levied with respect to the purchase of the Products by the Agent (excluding any taxes on the Company's income therefrom), and the Company will bear all taxes and duties which shall be levied upon any of the Products if incidental to the Company's production of such Product or any component thereof. The Company will supply the Agent with such reasonable and necessary documents as may be required to carry out these provisions.
ollama_generated: 2.4. Taxes. The Agent shall bear all taxes and duties that might arise from the acquisition of the Products by them (with the exception of any taxes on our company's income generated from such sales), while we, the Company, will shoulder all taxes and duties applicable to the manufacturing of the Products or any component thereof. We will provide the Agent with any necessary and reasonable documentation to facilitate this arrangement. This shift in tax responsibilities aims to streamline the overall transaction process.

original: ANY STATEMENTS MADE BY REPRESENTATIVES OF THE COMPANY WITH RESPECT TO THE PRODUCTS DO NOT CONSTITUTE WARRANTIES AND SHOULD NOT BE RELIED UPON BY THE AGENT.
ollama_generated: The Representatives of the Company's statements regarding the Products should not be construed as warranties and shall only serve for informational purposes. It is incumbent upon the Agent to independently verify all claims, representations, or warranties related to the Products before relying on them.

modified:
3.5. Shielding Against Liability.

In the event that any third party initiates legal action against the Client due to a breach of this Agreement or the Client's negligent or wrongful conduct, the Provider shall extend every reasonable effort to provide aid and support in defending such claims. However, the Client shall bear sole responsibility for any damages, losses, liabilities, costs, or expenses incurred as a result, and the Provider shall not be held accountable unless proven to have acted with gross negligence or willful misconduct.

4. DURATION AND CANCELLATION.

In the event that either Party desires to terminate this Agreement, they shall provide written notice to the other Party at least 30 days prior to the intended effective date of termination. Upon receipt of such notice, the receiving Party shall have the option to cure any breach or non-compliance within the said 30-day period. If the breaching Party fails to remedy the situation within this timeframe, the Agreement shall be deemed terminated immediately upon the expiration of the 30-day notice period. However, if the breach is incapable of remedy or if the non-breaching Party elects not to exercise the cure option, the Agreement may be terminated immediately upon written notice.

For clarity, termination of this Agreement shall not relieve either Party of any obligations accrued or becoming due prior to the effective date of termination, nor shall it affect any provisions intended to survive termination under applicable law.

original: (d) If after exercise of good faith efforts, the parties fail to timely agree upon a Business Plan for any Contract Year before the start of such year (with respect to the Business Plan for Contract Year ending October 31, 1999, at least thirty (30) days or on a mutually agreed upon date after the Agent Launch Date), this Agreement may be terminated by either party upon giving at least thirty (30) days prior written notice of such termination to the other party.
ollama_generated: (d) In the event that, despite best efforts, the parties cannot reach a consensus on a Business Plan within a reasonable timeframe prior to the commencement of any Contract Year (with respect to the Business Plan for the Contract Year ending October 31, 1999, at least thirty [30] days or upon a mutually agreed extension following the Agent Launch Date), either party retains the right to terminate this Agreement by providing at least thirty [30] days' written notice to the other party. The onus is on each party to make reasonable attempts to negotiate and reach an agreement before resorting to termination.

original: Postal Service, postage prepaid. Either party may give to the other written notice of change of address, in which event any communication will thereafter be given to such party at such changed address.
modified: Postal Service, Not Prepaid Postage. Any changes to the current address of either party must be communicated in writing promptly. Failure to provide updated contact information may result in continued delivery to the previous address, with no liability assumed by the recipient for any missed communications or delays in response.

original: 5.5. Force Majeure. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, if either the Company or the Agent is delayed in or prevented from fulfilling any of its obligations hereunder by reason of any cause beyond its reasonable control (including, but not limited to acts of God, fire, third party strike, flood, delay of transportation or inability to obtain necessary raw materials through normal commercial channels), then that party will not be liable under this Agreement for damages resulting from such delay or failure. Each party will promptly notify the other upon becoming aware of the occurrence of any such cause and will use its reasonable best efforts to minimize any resulting delay in or interference with the performance of its obligations hereunder.
ollama_generated: 5.5. Unforeseen Circumstances. Despite any other provision in this Agreement, if either the Company or the Agent encounters unanticipated circumstances hindering their ability to meet their obligations (beyond what would be considered a reasonable response, including, but not limited to acts of God, fire, third party lockout, flood, disruption of transportation, or lack of access to required materials through ordinary commercial channels), then they will not bear responsibility for any losses arising from such hindrances. Each party is expected to inform the other immediately upon discovery of such circumstances and will use their best possible efforts to expedite any delay or disruption in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement.

original: 5.7. Amendments. Neither this Agreement nor any provision hereof may be amended except by a writing duly signed on behalf of each party.
ollama_generated: 5.7. Amendments: Any attempt to modify or alter this Agreement, in whole or in part, shall not be effective unless such modification is made in writing and signed by both parties hereto. The lack of explicit written agreement will render any proposed amendment null and void.

Effectiveness Commencement:

In the event of any discrepancy between this Agreement's effective date as initially stated and the date on which both parties have fully executed all required documentation, the latter shall serve as the definitive commencement date for the purposes of this Agreement. In other words, the effectiveness of this Agreement shall be contingent upon the mutual completion of all necessary paperwork, with the resulting date becoming its effective date.

Rewritten Clause:
- In the event that either Party breaches any provision of this Agreement, the other Party shall not be obligated to perform its obligations hereunder for a period of thirty (30) days from the date on which the breaching Party has been made aware of such breach and has failed to remedy it. If the breaching Party fails to remedy such breach within this period, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing written notice. The breaching Party shall be liable for any losses incurred by the other Party as a result of the breach, provided that the non-breaching Party has mitigated its damages to the extent reasonably possible.

Rewritten Clause:
- In the event that either Party breaches any provision of this Agreement, the non-breaching Party shall have the discretion, but not the obligation, to suspend performance of its obligations for a period of thirty (30) days from the date on which the breaching Party has been made aware of such breach. If the breaching Party fails to remedy such breach within this period, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing written notice. The breaching Party shall be liable for any losses incurred by the other Party as a result of the breach, provided that the non-breaching Party has mitigated its damages to the extent reasonably possible. This provision is intended to give the non-breaching Party some discretion in managing the consequences of the breach while not saddling it with an undue obligation to continue performance under potentially unfair circumstances.
